solution_line_template: He sells the first ring for {first_ring_cost}/{sale_divisor}=${<<{first_ring_cost}/{sale_divisor}={first_ring_sale_value}>>}{first_ring_sale_value}
So he is out of pocket {first_ring_cost}-{first_ring_sale_value}=${<<{first_ring_cost}-{first_ring_sale_value}={out_of_pocket_first_ring}>>}{out_of_pocket_first_ring}
So that means he is out of pocket {second_ring_cost}+{out_of_pocket_first_ring}=${<<{second_ring_cost}+{out_of_pocket_first_ring}={total_out_of_pocket}>>}{total_out_of_pocket}
